cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles southwest of Key West, FL and 25 miles northwest of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west through the Florida Straits into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico, forecast to slow and turn WNW then NW, aiming for the northeast Gulf Coast of Florida
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / north-central Gulf Coast of Florida

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northern Florida Gulf Coast extending inland toward Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts possible late Wed night into Thu with a 27% cumulative chance of sustained 34-kt winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: None specified yet; risk currently low while system is a depression
weather_observation.rainfall: 1â€“4 inches expected through Wed with isolated higher amounts possible, enough for ponding and localized flooding around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls reducing visibility and creating rough bay/harbor conditions
